intro: Ononis baetica var. donanensis, commonly known as the Donan's bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
